result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew F May was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid within 30 days. Penalty of civil judgment for non-payment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Andrew F May

records.addlTxt:
09:40 AM Defendant Andrew F May in court with attorney Basil Martin Loeb.  Andrea M Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State is in compliance with victims rights.  State moves to amend to Disorderly Conduct contrary to section 13.102(c)(8)  of the Waukesha County Code of Ordinances.  Court approves amendment.  No contest plea entered.  Court finds the defendant guilty.
Court orders the following:

$267.50 to be paid within 30 days or civil judgment entered subject to collections, as penalty for non payment of fine.
Trial Scheduling Order signed by Judge Bugenhagen

Jury status hearing on May 19, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Jury trial - 12 person on May 24, 2022 at 08:15 am.

02:15 PM Attorney Basil Martin Loeb in court.   Defendant Andrew F May did not appear.   Andrew Nesheim appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Attorney appears by authorization.
Atty Loeb requests a trial date.
State does not object.  Jury status hearing scheduled for May 19, 2022 at 09:30 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for May 24, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Authorization to appear received and filed.

Adjustment Number: 22A 011087,
Payable Number: 460552,
Receipt Number: 22R 011693,
Amount: $20.00

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms/knives/tasers/pepper spray.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant to have no contact with Witness A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

08:54 AM Defendant Andrew F May in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Charlie Hoffmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Hearing scheduled for April 14, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Motion and order to seal victim/witness identification key
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal,  by the District Attorney's office.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
